title: Provides for grants to school districts in shortage areas to recruit and retain dental health professionals
summary: Provides for grants to school districts in shortage areas to recruit and retain dental health professionals; dentists and dental hygienist may apply for awards of up to $10,000 bonus per service year to work in school districts in shortage areas.

                                         1763

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. ORTIZ, PEOPLES-STOKES -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to establishing the chil-
         dren's dental health improvement act

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Short  title. This act shall be known and may be cited as
    2  the "children's dental health improvement act".
    3    S 2. The education law is amended by adding a  new  section  902-a  to
    4  read as follows:
    5    S  902-A.  DENTAL  HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. 1. DEFINITIONS.  A. THE
    6  TERM "SHORTAGE AREA" MEANS A FEDERALLY-DESIGNATED DENTAL HEALTH  PROFES-
    7  SIONAL SHORTAGE AREA; OR A SCHOOL DISTRICT IN WHICH AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE
    8  PERCENT  OF  THE  PATIENT POPULATION RECEIVES MEDICAID, FEDERALLY SUBSI-
    9  DIZED CHILD HEALTH INSURANCE PROGRAM FUNDS, OR IS UNINSURED  FOR  DENTAL
   10  CARE.
   11    B.  THE  TERM  "SCHOOL  DISTRICT"  SHALL  MEAN  A  COMMON, UNION FREE,
   12  CENTRAL, CENTRAL HIGH SCHOOL, OR CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT.
   13    C. THE TERM "BOARD OF EDUCATION" SHALL MEAN THE GOVERNING BOARD OF ANY
   14  PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICT DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH B OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   15    D. THE TERM "DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL" SHALL INCLUDE  A  DENTIST  OR
   16  DENTAL HYGIENIST AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-THREE OF THIS
   17  CHAPTER.
   18    E.  THE  TERM  "YEAR  OF  SERVICE" SHALL MEAN TEN MONTHS OF CONTINUOUS
   19  SERVICE AS A DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL DURING A SCHOOL YEAR,  GENERALLY
   20  OCCURRING BETWEEN SEPTEMBER FIRST AND JUNE THIRTIETH.
   21    F. THE TERM "COMMISSIONER" SHALL MEAN THE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION.
   22    2.  APPLICATION  AND  FUNDING.  A.  GRANTS  SHALL  BE  MADE  TO SCHOOL
   23  DISTRICTS FOR RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO INCREASE
   24  THE SUPPLY OF DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS IN SHORTAGE AREAS.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04017-01-1

       A. 1763                             2

    1    B. SUCH GRANTS SHALL BE AWARDED TO SCHOOL DISTRICTS, WITHIN THE LIMITS
    2  OF FUNDS APPROPRIATED THEREFOR, THROUGH A COMPETITIVE PROCESS THAT TAKES
    3  INTO CONSIDERATION THE  MAGNITUDE  OF  ANY  SHORTAGE  OF  DENTAL  HEALTH
    4  PROFESSIONALS IN THE SCHOOL DISTRICT, THE FISCAL CAPACITY AND POPULATION
    5  DENSITY  OF  THE  DISTRICT,  AND  THE  PERCENTAGE  OF PATIENT POPULATION
    6  RECEIVING MEDICAID, FEDERALLY SUBSIDIZED CHILD HEALTH INSURANCE  PROGRAM
    7  FUNDS  OR  NO  DENTAL  HEALTH COVERAGE. GRANTS PROVIDED PURSUANT TO THIS
    8  SECTION SHALL BE USED ONLY FOR THE PURPOSES ENUMERATED IN THIS SECTION.
    9    C. NOT MORE THAN SIXTY PERCENT OF THE FUNDS ALLOCATED PURSUANT TO THIS
   10  SECTION SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY ONE SCHOOL DISTRICT.
   11    D. IN ALLOCATING GRANTS PURSUANT TO  THIS  SECTION,  THE  COMMISSIONER
   12  SHALL GIVE PRIORITY TO DISTRICTS THAT ARE LOCATED IN SHORTAGE AREAS.
   13    E.  ANY SCHOOL DISTRICT RECEIVING FUNDS UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL MAIN-
   14  TAIN ANY LOCAL EFFORT IN THE CURRENT YEAR EQUIVALENT TO SUCH  EFFORT  IN
   15  THE  BASE  YEAR  FOR  ANY  LOCAL  PROGRAM  RELATED TO THE RECRUITMENT OR
   16  RETENTION OF  DENTAL  HEALTH  PROFESSIONALS  OR  ANY  PROGRAM  THAT  HAS
   17  PURPOSES THAT ARE SIMILAR TO ANY PURPOSE OF THIS SECTION OR THE DISTRICT
   18  SHALL  PROVIDE  A  LOCAL  MATCH TO STATE FUNDS RECEIVED PURSUANT TO THIS
   19  SECTION. STATE  FUNDS  PROVIDED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  NOT
   20  SUPPLANT  LOCAL  FUNDS  FOR  ANY PURPOSE SIMILAR TO THE PURPOSES OF THIS
   21  SECTION.
   22    F. APPLICATIONS BY A SCHOOL DISTRICT  FOR  FUNDING  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   23  SECTION  SHALL  BE  FILED WITH THE COMMISSIONER, IN A FORM DETERMINED BY
   24  THE COMMISSIONER, BY JUNE FIRST OF THE BASE YEAR  AND  SCHOOL  DISTRICTS
   25  SHALL  BE  NOTIFIED  OF  THEIR GRANT AWARD BY JUNE THIRTIETH OF THE BASE
   26  YEAR, PROVIDED THAT IN ANY YEAR SUCH APPLICATION AND AWARD DATES MAY  BE
   27  MODIFIED  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER FOR THE REASONABLE ADMINISTRATION OF THE
   28  PROGRAM. SUCH APPLICATION SHALL INCLUDE A PLAN BY  THE  SCHOOL  DISTRICT
   29  FOR THE EXPENDITURE OF THE FUNDS AND SUCH EXPENDITURES SHALL BE CONSIST-
   30  ENT WITH SUCH PLAN AND THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   31    3.  DENTAL  HEALTH  PROFESSIONAL RECRUITMENT INCENTIVE PROGRAM. DENTAL
   32  HEALTH PROFESSIONAL RECRUITMENT INCENTIVE AWARDS  MAY  BE  AVAILABLE  TO
   33  DENTISTS AND DENTAL HYGIENISTS PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDI-
   34  VISION  TO  RECRUIT  AND  RETAIN DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS TO SHORTAGE
   35  AREAS.
   36    A. ELIGIBILITY. (1) TO BE ELIGIBLE  FOR  AN  AWARD  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   37  SUBDIVISION, A DENTIST APPLICANT SHALL:
   38    (I) HAVE A LIMITED PERMIT OR PROFESSIONAL LICENSE AS PROVIDED IN ARTI-
   39  CLE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-THREE OF THIS CHAPTER;
   40    (II)  AGREE TO A SERVICE OBLIGATION OF AT LEAST ONE YEAR OF SERVICE IN
   41  A SHORTAGE AREA AS A CONDITION OF RECEIVING AN AWARD  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   42  SUBDIVISION; AND
   43    (III) BE EMPLOYED FOR THE FIRST TIME AS A DENTIST IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOL
   44  OR SCHOOL DISTRICT.
   45    (2)  TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR AN AWARD PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION A DENTAL
   46  HYGIENIST APPLICANT SHALL:
   47    (I) HAVE A LIMITED PERMIT, OR  LICENSE  AS  PROVIDED  IN  ARTICLE  ONE
   48  HUNDRED THIRTY-THREE OF THIS CHAPTER;
   49    (II)  AGREE TO A SERVICE OBLIGATION OF AT LEAST ONE YEAR OF SERVICE IN
   50  A SHORTAGE AREA AS A CONDITION OF RECEIVING AN AWARD  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   51  SUBDIVISION; AND
   52    (III)  BE  EMPLOYED  FOR  THE  FIRST TIME AS A DENTAL HYGIENIST IN THE
   53  PUBLIC SCHOOL OR SCHOOL DISTRICT.
   54    B. APPLICATION AND SELECTION. (1) THE BOARD OF EDUCATION SHALL  DETER-
   55  MINE  THE  FORM  OF  THE  APPLICATION  AND  THE  APPLICATION PROCESS FOR
   56  DENTISTS AND DENTAL HYGIENISTS DEEMED ELIGIBLE FOR THE AWARD, AND  SHALL

       A. 1763                             3

    1  IN  ITS  DISCRETION  SELECT  THE  NUMBER OF ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS WHO WILL
    2  RECEIVE AN AWARD PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION.
    3    (2)  IF THE NUMBER OF ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS EXCEEDS THE NUMBER OF AWARDS
    4  DETERMINED BY THE BOARD PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION,  THE  BOARD  SHALL
    5  USE AN OBJECTIVE COMPETITIVE PROCESS BASED ON EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
    6  TO DETERMINE WHICH ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS SHALL RECEIVE AWARDS.
    7    C.  PAYMENT  OF  AWARDS.  (1) ANNUAL AWARDS FROM STATE AND LOCAL FUNDS
    8  PROVIDED FOR THIS PURPOSE SHALL BE PAID BY THE BOARD OF EDUCATION TO THE
    9  AWARD RECIPIENT. AWARD RECIPIENTS SHALL BE ENTITLED  TO  RECEIVE  AWARDS
   10  PURSUANT  TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION AND SUCH AWARDS SHALL BE
   11  IN ADDITION TO AND NOT PART OF ANY AWARD RECIPIENT'S BASE SALARY.
   12    (2) THE INITIAL ANNUAL AWARD SHALL BE THE EQUIVALENT OF  ONE  THOUSAND
   13  DOLLARS FOR EACH MONTH OF ELIGIBLE SERVICE PROVIDED IN THE SERVICE YEAR,
   14  AND SUCH INITIAL AWARD MAY BE RENEWABLE EACH YEAR, FOR UP TO THREE ADDI-
   15  TIONAL  YEARS, PROVIDED THAT THE RECIPIENT AGREES TO ONE YEAR OF SERVICE
   16  AS A DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL IN A SHORTAGE AREA FOR EACH  YEAR  OF  A
   17  RENEWED AWARD AND HAS PROVIDED SATISFACTORY SERVICE IN ANY PRIOR YEAR IN
   18  WHICH  AN  INITIAL  OR  RENEWED  AWARD WAS GRANTED TO THE RECIPIENT.  NO
   19  AWARDS SHALL BE MADE FOR LESS THAN ONE SCHOOL YEAR OF  SERVICE  AND  THE
   20  SUM  OF  ANY  INITIAL  AND  RENEWED  AWARD SHALL NOT EXCEED TEN THOUSAND
   21  DOLLARS PER AWARD.
   22    (3) THE BOARD OF EDUCATION SHALL DEVELOP AND  SECURE  FROM  THE  AWARD
   23  RECIPIENT  A  WRITTEN  AGREEMENT OUTLINING THE SERVICE OBLIGATION.  SUCH
   24  AGREEMENT SHALL INCLUDE PROVISIONS FOR THE RECIPIENT TO REPAY THE AMOUNT
   25  OF THE AWARD TO THE SCHOOL DISTRICT IF THE RECIPIENT FAILS  TO  COMPLETE
   26  THEIR  SERVICE  OBLIGATION IN ANY YEAR WHERE AN INITIAL OR RENEWED AWARD
   27  IS GRANTED, AND SUCH REPAID AMOUNTS SHALL BE  DEDUCTED  FROM  ANY  GRANT
   28  AMOUNTS DUE TO THE DISTRICT FROM THE STATE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   29    UPON  A  WRITTEN APPEAL BY AN AWARD RECIPIENT, THE BOARD OF EDUCATION,
   30  IN ITS DISCRETION, MAY PROVIDE A WAIVER OF REPAYMENT PROVISIONS  FOR  AN
   31  AWARD RECIPIENT WHO FAILS TO COMPLETE HIS OR HER SERVICE REQUIREMENT FOR
   32  DOCUMENTED  REASONS OF HEALTH OR OTHER SEVERE HARDSHIP, AS DETERMINED BY
   33  THE COMMISSIONER.
   34    D. NOTIFICATION.  THE BOARD OF EDUCATION SHALL NOTIFY BOTH  SUCCESSFUL
   35  AND  UNSUCCESSFUL  APPLICANTS  BY SEPTEMBER FIRST OF ANY SCHOOL YEAR FOR
   36  WHICH AN INITIAL OR RENEWED AWARD IS PROVIDED  TO  ONE  OR  MORE  DENTAL
   37  HEALTH PROFESSIONALS PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION.
   38    4.  REPORTING.  BY  NOVEMBER  FIRST  FOLLOWING  THE COMPLETION OF EACH
   39  SCHOOL YEAR, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL  REPORT  TO  THE  GOVERNOR  AND  THE
   40  LEGISLATURE  REGARDING THE DENTAL HEALTH IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.  A COPY OF
   41  SUCH REPORT SHALL ALSO BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE COMMISSIONER OF  HEALTH.
   42  SUCH  REPORT SHALL LIST THE AMOUNT OF EACH SCHOOL DISTRICT'S TOTAL GRANT
   43  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, THE NUMBER OF AWARDS GRANTED PURSUANT TO  THIS
   44  SECTION AND, IF APPLICABLE, THE NUMBER OF DENTISTS AND DENTAL HYGIENISTS
   45  RECEIVING  SUCH  AWARDS,  AS WELL AS AN ANALYSIS OF THE EFFECTIVENESS OF
   46  THE PROGRAM IN RECRUITING DENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS IN  THE  AREAS  OF
   47  THE STATE DESIGNATED AS SHORTAGE AREAS.
   48    S  3.  Early childhood caries study and report. 1. The commissioner of
   49  health shall, within amounts made available therefor,  conduct  a  study
   50  that  includes  the  following  components:  (a) identifies local public
   51  health regions and districts containing children at high risk for  early
   52  childhood caries;
   53    (b) collects, analyzes and disseminates data on early childhood caries
   54  to local school districts; and
   55    (c)  develops public health education programs to prevent early child-
   56  hood caries.

       A. 1763                             4

    1    2. Such study shall be conducted and completed within eighteen  months
    2  of the effective date of this act.
    3    3.  Within  twenty-four  months of the effective date of this act, the
    4  commissioner of health shall report to the legislature and the  governor
    5  on  the  results of the study on early childhood caries, and make recom-
    6  mendations for expansion of the public health education component of the
    7  early childhood caries study.
    8    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
